raw: * The Placement module provides a convenient way to align two elements relative
* to each other using various pre-defined algorithms.

@description.name: @description

raw: * Moves the first element in the collection, aligning it with the given
* NOTE: The placeTo method also works for hidden
* elements. However, the visibility / display styles are only manipulated during
* the placement operation. As a result a previously hidden element stays hidden
* NOTE: If the target is changing its position due e.g. a DOM manipulation the
* placed element is not updated automatically. You have to call placeTo
* again to place the element to the target. The element is always positioned by using
* @param position {String} Alignment of the object with the target, any of
* @param offsets {Map?null} Map with the desired offsets between the two elements.
* @param modeX {String?"direct"} Horizontal placement mode. Valid values are:

*
  • direct: place the element directly at the given

*
  • keep-align: if the element is partially outside of the
*   visible area, it is moved to the best fitting 'edge' and 'alignment' of
*   It is guaranteed the the new position attaches the object to one of the
* target edges and that it is aligned with a target edge.

*
  • best-fit: If the element is partially outside of the visible
*   area, it is moved into the view port, ignoring any offset and position
* @param modeY {String?"direct"} Vertical placement mode. Accepts the same values as

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Moves the first element in the collection, aligning it with the given target.

NOTE: The placeTo method also works for hidden elements. However, the visibility / display styles are only manipulated during the placement operation. As a result a previously hidden element stays hidden
NOTE: If the target is changing its position due e.g. a DOM manipulation the placed element is not updated automatically. You have to call placeTo again to place the element to the target. The element is always positioned by using position:absolute independently on the chosen position and mode.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: position {String} Alignment of the object with the target, any of "top-left", "top-center", "top-right", "bottom-left", "bottom-center", "bottom-right", "left-top", "left-middle", "left-bottom", "right-top", "right-middle", "right-bottom"
@param.description: Alignment of the object with the target, any of "top-left", "top-center", "top-right", "bottom-left", "bottom-center", "bottom-right", "left-top", "left-middle", "left-bottom", "right-top", "right-middle", "right-bottom"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: offsets {Map?null} Map with the desired offsets between the two elements. Must contain the keys left, top, right and bottom
@param.description: Map with the desired offsets between the two elements. Must contain the keys left, top, right and bottom

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
modeX {String?"direct"} Horizontal placement mode. Valid values are:
  • direct: place the element directly at the given location.
  • keep-align: if the element is partially outside of the visible area, it is moved to the best fitting 'edge' and 'alignment' of the target. It is guaranteed the the new position attaches the object to one of the target edges and that it is aligned with a target edge.
  • best-fit: If the element is partially outside of the visible area, it is moved into the view port, ignoring any offset and position values.
@param.description:
Horizontal placement mode. Valid values are:
  • direct: place the element directly at the given location.
  • keep-align: if the element is partially outside of the visible area, it is moved to the best fitting 'edge' and 'alignment' of the target. It is guaranteed the the new position attaches the object to one of the target edges and that it is aligned with a target edge.
  • best-fit: If the element is partially outside of the visible area, it is moved into the view port, ignoring any offset and position values.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
modeY {String?"direct"} Vertical placement mode. Accepts the same values as
   the 'modeX' argument.
@param.description:
Vertical placement mode. Accepts the same values as
   the 'modeX' argument.
